extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.hl7.ExtractHL7Attributes
extension.description: Extracts information from an HL7 (Health Level 7) formatted FlowFile and adds the information as FlowFile Attributes. The attributes are named as <Segment Name> <dot> <Field Index>. If the segment is repeating, the naming will be <Segment Name> <underscore> <Segment Index> <dot> <Field Index>. For example, we may have an attribute named "MHS.12" with a value of "2.1" and an attribute named "OBX_11.3" with a value of "93000^CPT4".

property.name: Character Encoding
property.description: The Character Encoding that is used to encode the HL7 data

property.name: use-segment-names
property.description: Whether or not to use HL7 segment names in attributes

property.name: parse-segment-fields
property.description: Whether or not to parse HL7 segment fields into attributes

property.name: skip-validation
property.description: Whether or not to validate HL7 message values

property.name: hl7-input-version
property.description: The HL7 version to use for parsing and validation

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it cannot be mapped to FlowFile Attributes. This would happen if the FlowFile does not contain valid HL7 data

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: A FlowFile is routed to this relationship if it is properly parsed as HL7 and its attributes extracted

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.processors.hl7.RouteHL7
extension.description: Routes incoming HL7 data according to user-defined queries. To add a query, add a new property to the processor. The name of the property will become a new relationship for the processor, and the value is an HL7 Query Language query. If a FlowFile matches the query, a copy of the FlowFile will be routed to the associated relationship.

property.name: Character Encoding
property.description: The Character Encoding that is used to encode the HL7 data

dynamicProperty.name: Name of a Relationship
dynamicProperty.description: If a FlowFile matches the query, it will be routed to a relationship with the name of the property

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: Any FlowFile that cannot be parsed as HL7 will be routed to this relationship

relationship.name: original
relationship.description: The original FlowFile that comes into this processor will be routed to this relationship, unless it is routed to 'failure'

writesAttribute.name: RouteHL7.Route
writesAttribute.description: The name of the relationship to which the FlowFile was routed
